input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: CEO has a direct effect on director and manager. Manager has a direct effect on foot size. Director has a direct effect on foot size. Method 1: We look directly at how manager correlates with foot size in general. Method 2: We look at this correlation case by case according to director. To understand how manager affects foot size, is it more correct to use the Method 1 than Method 2?
